title: How Many Calories in Half a Banana?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in half banana, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, and fat details on a per-banana basis with easy tweaks.
h1: How Many Calories in Half a Banana?
assumptions: Medium banana (~118 g whole, peeled), raw, ripe; half refers to one-half of the fruit.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by banana size, ripeness, variety, and storage; values are averages. Check fresh produce for specifics.

quick_answer.text: Half a medium banana provides ~53 kcal, 14 g carbs, and 1.5 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in half banana?
faqs.a: About 53 kcal for half a medium banana.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in half a banana?
faqs.a: Approximately 13.5 g carbs, including 1.5 g fiber and 7 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is protein high in half banana?
faqs.a: No, just 0.65 g protein; it's mostly carbs from natural sugars.

faqs.q: How does banana size affect calories?
faqs.a: Smaller bananas have fewer calories (e.g., ~42 kcal whole); larger up to 120 kcal.

faqs.q: Does ripeness change calories in banana?
faqs.a: Riper bananas have more sugars but similar total calories; starch converts to sugar.
